item.title: 2024 年欧盟太阳能发电量首次超过煤炭发电量
item.description: 一份报告显示，太阳能发电量的激增帮助这一绿色能源去年在欧盟首次超过了燃煤发电站。【原文：A surge of solar power output helped the green energy source overtake coal-fired stations in the European Union for the first time last year, a report shows.】

item.title: 不间断的野火让全球灭火武器库捉襟见肘
item.description:
洛杉矶的野火是通过共享飞机和多国人员来扑灭的。现在，随着火季的重叠和火势的扩大，这些合作正在经受考验。【原文：

Los Angeles wildfires are being battled by shared planes and multi-national personnel. Now, with overlapping fire seasons and bigger infernos, those collaborations are being put to the test.

】

item.title: 洛杉矶北部发生火灾，威胁重要的州际公路
item.description: 一场植被火灾正在洛杉矶北部迅速蔓延，威胁着加利福尼亚州的一条主要交通要道。【原文：A vegetation fire is spreading rapidly north of Los Angeles, threatening one of California’s main transportation arteries.】

item.title: 130 年来最严重的暴风雪使美国南部陷入极寒混乱之中
item.description: 在美国南部，极端天气通常意味着用木板封住窗户以抵御飓风，在街道上铺设沙袋以阻挡洪水。本周，从佛罗里达州到德克萨斯州，严寒的气温和破纪录的降雪反而让居民们急忙赶往取暖中心，并造成道路和跑道的混乱。【原文：Across the US South, extreme weather usually means boarding up windows against hurricane winds and lining streets with sandbags to hold back floods. This week, freezing temperatures and record-breaking snowfall are instead sending residents from Florida to Texas rushing to warming centers, and causing chaos on roads and runways.】

item.title: 达沃斯气候小组敦促首席执行官帮助适应极端天气
item.description: 世界气象组织秘书长敦促企业更加努力地提供极端天气预警，并帮助将气候变化联系起来。【原文：The Secretary-General of the World Meteorological Organization urged businesses to work harder to provide early warnings on extreme weather and help connect the dots with climate change.】

item.title: 深冻使美国最大电网的电力需求创下冬季纪录
item.description: 随着美国南部从 130 年来最严重的暴风雪中恢复过来，一场深度冰冻正在使整个美国东部的电力供应紧张，使美国最大电网的需求量达到冬季历史最高水平。【原文：A deep freeze is straining power supplies across the eastern US, sending demand on the country’s largest electric grid to an all-time winter high as the South digs out from one of the worst snow storms in 130 years.】

item.title: 卡塔尔希望欧盟重新研究影响液化天然气贸易的 ESG 规则
item.description: 卡塔尔财政部长表示，欧洲为与集团有贸易往来的大公司制定了严格的环境、社会和公司治理报告标准，这一规定造成了不公平竞争。【原文：A European regulation setting strict ESG-reporting standards for large companies trading with the bloc creates unfair competition, Qatar’s finance minister said.】

item.title: 美国养鸡第一大州佐治亚州禽流感威胁出口
item.description: 美国第一大鸡肉生产州佐治亚州确认了最近第二例商业禽群禽流感病例，这使得肉类出口面临风险。【原文：Georgia, the top US chicken-producing state, confirmed its second recent case of bird flu in a commercial poultry flock, putting exports of the meat at risk.】

item.title: 特朗普的气候政策倒退危及为贫困国家提供的重要资金
item.description:
美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）退出了帮助发展中国家应对气候变化的协议，为在极端天气日益恶化的情况下撤回急需的支持奠定了基础。【原文：

US President Donald Trump pulled out of a deal to help developing nations fight climate change, laying the groundwork to withdraw much-needed support as extreme weather gets worse.

】

item.title: 风险建模人员为预测野火寻找答案
item.description: 今天的时事通讯将从保险公司和房主的角度探讨野火问题。首先，风险专家解释了建立类似本月洛杉矶野火模型的艰巨任务。【原文：Today’s newsletter looks at wildfires from the perspectives of insurers and homeowners. First, risk experts explain the challenging task of modeling wildfires like the ones seen in Los Angeles this month.】

item.title: 野火风险模型难以预测洛杉矶式火灾
item.description:
保险业专家表示，由于气温升高、植被覆盖、风速和地形等因素的影响，火灾很难预测。【原文：

Fires are notoriously hard to forecast, insurance industry experts say, because of factors ranging from rising temperature levels and vegetation coverage to wind speeds and topographies.

】

item.title: 洛杉矶大火重创正在与保险索赔作斗争的房主
item.description:
失去家园的人们面临着长达数年的追讨赔款之战 ，因为保险公司正在处理因破坏性更大的野火而激增的索赔要求。【原文：

People who’ve lost their homes have faced yearslong battles to recover payouts as insurers deal with a surge in claims arising from more destructive wildfires.

】

item.title: 绿色和平组织在荷兰法院氮污染诉讼中胜诉
item.description: 荷兰政府必须进一步削减氮污染，否则将面临 1,000 万欧元（1,050 万美元）的罚款。在与绿色和平组织的法庭斗争中败诉后，这场长达十年之久的政治辩论重新点燃，对农业、交通和其他关键行业产生了影响。【原文：The Dutch government must make further cuts to nitrogen pollution or risk a €10 million ($10.5 million) fine after losing a court fight with Greenpeace that’s reignited a decade-long political debate impacting agriculture, transportation, and other key industries.】

item.title: 德国可能需要比计划更长时间保留后备煤电厂
item.description: 电网运营商 Amprion GmbH 警告说，由于建造新天然气发电厂的计划严重滞后，德国可能需要在比预期更长的时间内保留其停运的燃煤发电站。【原文：Germany may need to keep its fleet of mothballed coal-fired stations available for longer than expected as a drive to build new gas plants is severely behind schedule, grid operator Amprion GmbH warned.】

item.title: 沙索公司重新关注煤炭行业，为实现排放目标规划新路线
item.description: 萨索尔有限公司（Sasol Ltd.南非第二大污染企业萨索尔公司（Sasol Ltd.）首席执行官西蒙-巴洛伊（Simon Baloyi）在加倍使用煤炭生产燃料和化学品之后，正在为实现其排放目标寻求新的途径。【原文：Sasol Ltd. Chief Executive Officer Simon Baloyi is seeking a new path for South Africa’s second-largest polluter to reach its emissions target after doubling down on coal to run its fuel and chemicals production.】

item.title: 埃文风暴将携破坏性狂风和暴雨袭击英国
item.description: 本周晚些时候，"艾奥文 "冬季风暴有可能在英国引发停电和旅行中断。【原文：Winter Storm Éowyn is gathering strength, supercharged by the Arctic blast that moved through the US, and has the potential to trigger power outages and travel disruptions across the UK later this week.】

item.title: 印度尼西亚致力于在 2035 年前遏制林业排放增长
item.description: 印尼一位高级官员表示，印尼的目标是通过保护森林和泥炭地来减轻污染，到 2035 年将排放量的增长限制在 2019 年水平的 23%。【原文：Indonesia aims to limit emissions growth to 23% by 2035 from 2019 levels through conserving forests and peatlands to mitigate pollution, according to a top official.】

item.title: 特朗普对气候规则的攻击瞄准了重要的法律支柱
item.description: 15 年多来，美国联邦政府根据地球变暖污染危及公众健康和福利的结论，对温室气体排放实施了限制。【原文：For more than 15 years, the US federal government has slapped limits on greenhouse gas emissions based on a conclusion that planet-warming pollution imperils public health and welfare.】

item.title: 美国最大电网发布警报，寒冷使需求量接近创纪录水平
item.description: 由于寒冷天气增加了电力需求，运营着从华盛顿特区到伊利诺伊州的美国最大电网的 PJM 互联公司周三发布了一级紧急警报。【原文：PJM Interconnection, which operates the largest US grid from Washington DC to Illinois, issued a Level 1 emergency alert for Wednesday as cold weather boosts electricity demand.】

item.title: 更便宜的电动汽车将考验印度人对油耗车的热爱
item.description: 当 Anant Vijay Kala 的前一辆车达到新德里严格的 15 年车龄限制时，他在一个较小的城市卖掉了这辆车，并用这笔钱为他的下一辆车提供了部分资金。他从未考虑过更清洁的替代品。【原文：When Anant Vijay Kala’s previous car reached New Delhi’s stringent 15-year age limit, he sold it in a smaller city and used the money to part fund his next vehicle — a gasoline-powered Skoda Kushaq. A cleaner alternative never came into consideration.】

item.title: Impax 首席执行官称突然失去 60 亿美元授权是一个 "打击
item.description: Impax Asset Management Group Plc 首席执行官表示，最大客户之一的突然退出是一个挫折，公司正着手进行一系列战略调整，以扭转连年亏损的局面。【原文：The chief executive officer of Impax Asset Management Group Plc says the sudden exit of one of its biggest clients represents a setback, as the firm embarks on a number of strategy adjustments to reverse a losing streak.】

item.title: 斯塔默因希思罗机场扩建计划面临工党分裂
item.description: 基尔-斯塔默（Keir Starmer）计划为伦敦希思罗机场的第三条跑道开绿灯，但这一计划有可能在其执政的工党内部引发破坏性的分裂，因为他自己的内阁也对该计划对环境、经济增长和地区不平等的潜在影响感到担忧。【原文：Keir Starmer’s plans to green-light a third runway at London’s Heathrow Airport risk triggering a damaging split within his governing Labour Party amid concerns that extend into his own cabinet about its potential impact on the environment, growth and regional inequality.】

item.title: 在法国的要求下，欧盟将削减 ESG 报告规则
item.description: 欧盟可能会缩减其备受争议的环境、社会和公司治理报告要求，因为法国准备公布一项正式提案，寻求限制监管框架的范围。【原文：The European Union is likely to scale back its highly contested ESG reporting requirements, as France prepares to unveil a formal proposal seeking to limit the scope of the regulatory framework.】

item.title: 罕见冬季风暴考验德克萨斯州电网，引发路易斯安那州暴雪和大雪预警
item.description: 一场罕见的冬季风暴引发了路易斯安那州的暴雪预警、新奥尔良创纪录的降雪呼声以及德克萨斯州电网的输电预警。【原文：A rare winter storm has triggered a blizzard warning in Louisiana, calls for record snow in New Orleans and transmission warnings for the Texas grid.】

item.title: 欧盟政治家谴责特朗普退出气候公约的举动
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普宣布，这个世界上最富裕的国家将退出具有里程碑意义的应对气候变化的《巴黎协定》，同时对美国的能源格局进行全面改革，这令欧洲政界人士大为震惊。【原文：European politicians bristled as President Donald Trump announced the world’s wealthiest nation would pull out of the landmark Paris Agreement to combat climate change along with a sweeping overhaul of the US energy landscape.】

item.title: 风险投资人克莱里科表示，洛杉矶大火为野火技术投资提供了有利条件
item.description:
Convective Capital 的创始人表示，公用事业公司和保险公司等 "财大气粗 "的客户急于降低他们在下一次气候灾难中的风险。【原文：

The founder of Convective Capital says there are “deep-pocketed” customers such as utilities and insurers that are eager to reduce their exposure to the next climate disaster. 

】

item.title: 卢拉任命长期气候外交官担任巴西 COP30 主席
item.description: 巴西总统路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦已决定任命巴西外交部能源与环境事务秘书安德烈-科雷亚-多拉戈（Andre Correa do Lago）为巴西今年晚些时候将主办的联合国气候变化年会的负责人。【原文：President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva has decided to name Andre Correa do Lago, the secretary of energy and environment at Brazil’s foreign affairs ministry, as head of the annual United Nations Climate Change Conference the country will host later this year.】

item.title: 冬雨迟迟未至，洛杉矶严阵以待，应对干燥寒风带来的火灾风险
item.description: 周二，危险的大风和干旱将给整个南加州带来极高的火灾风险，1100 多万人将处于大火蔓延的危险之中，因为该地区仍对降雨抱有希望。【原文：Dangerous winds and drought will create extreme fire risk across Southern California Tuesday, putting more than 11 million people in the path of conditions that would allow blazes to spread quickly as the region holds out hope for rain.】

item.title: 南方水务公司首席执行官就环境绩效不佳道歉
item.description: 南方水务有限公司（Southern Water Ltd.）首席执行官为公司糟糕的环境表现向英国立法者道歉，并补充说，大股东麦格理（Macquarie）将全力支持公司扭转颓势。【原文：Southern Water Ltd. chief executive apologized to UK lawmakers for the company’s poor environmental performance, adding that it has the full support of major shareholder Macquarie to turn its fortunes around.】

item.title: 瑞银集团埃尔莫蒂分析华尔街从气候组织撤退的原因
item.description: 瑞银集团（UBS Group AG）首席执行官塞尔吉奥-埃尔莫蒂（Sergio Ermotti）表示，他正在考虑是否效仿华尔街同行，放弃一个重要的气候融资联盟，因为贷款机构正试图保护自己免受日益加剧的政治压力。【原文：UBS Group AG Chief Executive Officer Sergio Ermotti said he’s looking at whether to follow Wall Street peers in abandoning a key climate-finance alliance, as lenders seek to protect themselves from intensifying political pressure.】
